data.title: quentin tarantino
data.meta_description: I don't care if this thread is moved after I get an answer. I just want to know if quentin tarantino went to UT. I know he was born in Knoxville but I can't...

google is your friend:

Tarantino was born in Knoxville, Tennessee, the son of Connie McHugh Tarantino Zastoupil, a health care executive and nurse born in Knoxville, and Tony Tarantino, an actor and amateur musician born in Queens, New York.[2] Tarantino's father is Italian American and his mother is of Irish and Cherokee Native American ancestry.[3][4][5] He was raised solely by his mother, as his parents had separated before their son's birth.[6] When he was two years old, his mother moved with her son to Torrance, California, and later moved to the Harbor City neighborhood of Los Angeles.[6] He attended Narbonne High School in Harbor City for his freshman year before dropping out of school at age 15. Quentin and his childhood friend, Adam Olis,[6] began to make movies in his backyard using cheap animations. He attended acting school at the James Best Theatre Company in Toluca Lake. At age 22, he held employment at the Video Archives, a now defunct video rental store in Manhattan Beach where he and fellow movie buffs like Roger Avary spent all day discussing and recommending films to customers.[7]

Quentin Tarantino - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Tarantino was born in Knoxville, Tennessee, the son of Connie McHugh Tarantino Zastoupil, a health care executive and nurse born in Knoxville, and Tony Tarantino, an actor and amateur musician born in Queens, New York.[2] Tarantino's father is Italian American and his mother is of Irish and Cherokee Native American ancestry.[3][4][5] He was raised solely by his mother, as his parents had separated before their son's birth.[6] When he was two years old, his mother moved with her son to Torrance, California, and later moved to the Harbor City neighborhood of Los Angeles.[6] He attended Narbonne High School in Harbor City for his freshman year before dropping out of school at age 15. Quentin and his childhood friend, Adam Olis,[6] began to make movies in his backyard using cheap animations. He attended acting school at the James Best Theatre Company in Toluca Lake. At age 22, he held employment at the Video Archives, a now defunct video rental store in Manhattan Beach where he and fellow movie buffs like Roger Avary spent all day discussing and recommending films to customers.[7]

Quentin Tarantino - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Thanks. I did a word search of college on his wiki page and came up with nothing. I didn't want to read his bio because I think his movies suck and was just wondering. Watching Hostel right now and it's one of the worst movies I've ever seen. Glad he didn't go to UT.

I get sick of people here in Knoxville claiming to have a family member or friend that knew someone who knew QT while he was growing up here. He didn't grow up here at all. It is like someone always has a aunt or friend that knows a person that was working at a hospital when 'insert person on the local news' came in with something stuck up their rear.

I guess you can say the same thing about people knowing Johnny Knoxville but at least that could be true.

Tarantino neither wrote or directed Hostel, fyi.

Eli Roth aka the Bear Jew did.

And I was right... he dropped out. So there ya go. I just figured the guy actually went to college since he gets paid money to write and direct bad movies.

Everyone has different taste , but I find you very incorrect in this statement.

I hope IB gets a Oscar nod because it is his best movie since Pulp Fiction.
